description.narrative: 1. Driving Financial Inclusion: Indonesia''s GDP has shown healthy growth in the past few years but with only 50-60 million Indonesians having access to financial services out of a total population of 250 million, there is a strong need for development of a wide payments network in Indonesia. IFC''s investment in Kartuku would would make financial services available at a low cost to a large part of the Indonesian population currently not served by banks and other financial services companies. In addition, Kartuku''s new service lines such as mPoS are expected to boost digital payments among MSMEs and merchants. 2. Financial Infrastructure: With their expansion, Kartuku will contribute significantly in improving the modern electronic payment infrastructure of Indonesia. 3. Private Sector Development: The Project will help to create a leading Indonesia payment services provider in Indonesia. Launch of internet payment and cash collection will help the growing e-commerce industry.

PT Multi Adiprakarsa Manunggal (Kartuku or the Company) is an Indonesian payments services provider/payments processor established in 2001. Kartuku is one of the first companies in Indonesia to successfully integrate the countrys major banks and large retailers into a fully integrated end-to-end payment network infrastructure. IFC is considering an equity and debt investment in the Company to support the expansion of the business in Indonesia (the Project).

mailing-address.narrative: Antoine de Carbonnel PT. Multi Adiprakarsa Manunggal Setiabudi 2 Building, 3rd Floor, Suite 302 - 305 Jl. HR Rasuna Said Kav 62, Kuningan Jakarta 12920. Indonesia Telephone: +62-21-2991-5699 Fax: +62-21-5290-3064 http://www.kartuku.com

name.narrative: Kartuku is headquartered in Jakarta, Indonesia and operates anation-wide field services covering 110 cities across Indonesia.
